intro: Cacalia alpina, commonly known as the Alpine cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming a dense head that resembles a dandelion. Cacalia alpina is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand cold temperatures, making it a resilient species in high-altitude ecosystems.
